class_notes:
The course is directed to first- and second-year students interested in learning Python for
complex projects (in upper-level courses), in particular math, computer science, physics, and
potentially, biology and chemistry. However, it can also be taken by junior and senior students
of other disciplines who want to learn Python for AI-oriented projects.
No prerequisites, all interested students are welcome!
course_description: The course introduces Python for Scientific Computing for students who will likely use it in upper-level courses. Students will know how to algorithmically formulate a mathematical problem, solve simple scientific computing problems, visualize data, and consider different programming paradigms.
schedule_location: TTh 4pm-5:15pm in Math & Science Center - W301
